What book is The movie Lyle, Lyle, Crocodile based on?

The movieLyle, Lyle, Crocodile is based on the bookLyle, Lyle, Crocodilewritten byÂ  Bernard Waber

Lyle, Lyle, CrocodilePublished by Houghton Mifflin Harcourt - 1/1/1965

Lyle is afraid of losing his family forever after he is taken from their New York apartment and committed to a zoo.

Related books / From the author(s)

Lyle, Lyle, Crocodile

written byBernard Waber

Published by Houghton Mifflin Harcourt - 1/1/1965

Lyle is afraid of losing his family forever after he is taken from their New York apartment and committed to a zoo.

Lyle, Lyle, Crocodile Storybook Treasury

written byBernard Waber

Published by Harcourt Brace - 1/1/2012

Presents four stories featuring the Primm family and their lovable adopted crocodile Lyle.

Lyle at Christmas

written byBernard Waber

Published by Houghton Mifflin Harcourt - 9/1/2003

At Christmas time, Lyle the crocodile helps Mr. Grumps search for his missing cat Loretta.

Lovable Lyle

written byBernard Waber

Published by Houghton Mifflin Harcourt - 4/1/1977

Lyle, the crocodile, thought everyone loved him until the day he received a hate note from an anonymous despiser.

Funny, Funny Lyle

written byBernard Waber

Published by Houghton Mifflin Harcourt - 1/1/1987

Lyle the crocodile exeriences many changes in his life when his mother moves in with the Primm family and Mrs. Primm announces she is expecting a baby.

Did you know that the movie Lyle, Lyle, Crocodile is based on the book Lyle, Lyle, Crocodile?

Follows the title reptile who lives in a house on East 88th Street in New York City. Lyle enjoys helping the Primm family with everyday chores and playing with the neighborhood kids but one neighbor insists that Lyle belongs in a zoo. Mr. Grumps and his cat, Loretta, do not like crocodiles, and Lyle tries to prove that he is not as bad as others might first think.
